com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses

Class HISankey

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HISeries
        • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HISankey
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIChartsJSONSerializable

    public class HISankey
extends HISeries
    A sankey series. If the type option is not specified, it is inherited from chart.type. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels: 1. Options for all series in a chart are defined in the [plotOptions.series](plotOptions.series) object. 2. Options for all sankey series are defined in [plotOptions.sankey](plotOptions.sankey). 3. Options for one single series are given in [the series instance array](series.sankey). Highcharts.chart('container', { plotOptions: { series: { // general options for all series }, sankey: { // shared options for all sankey series } }, series: [{ // specific options for this series instance type: 'sankey' }] });

        public void setColorByPoint(java.lang.Boolean colorByPoint)
        description: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point. demo:  •  https://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/plotoptions/column-colorbypoint-false/ : False by default •  https://jsfiddle.net/gh/get/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/plotoptions/column-colorbypoint-true/ : True* default: false

      • setCurveFactor

        public void setCurveFactor(java.lang.Number curveFactor)
        Higher numbers makes the links in a sankey diagram render more curved. A curveFactor of 0 makes the lines straight.

      • getCurveFactor

      • setMinPointLength

        public void setMinPointLength(java.lang.Number minPointLength)
        The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a pixel value like 3\. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values.

        Try it:

         •  Zero base value
         •  Positive and negative close to zero values

      • getMinPointLength

      • getColors

        public java.util.ArrayList<HIColor> getColors()

      • setNodes

        public void setNodes(java.util.ArrayList nodes)
        A collection of options for the individual nodes. The nodes in a sankey diagram are auto-generated instances of Highcharts.Point, but options can be applied here and linked by the id.

        Try it:

         •  Sankey diagram with node options
